item.title: Focus with Alfred
item.description: One of things that kept bugging me at work was a problem a lot of may be familiar with: switching contexts far too often. Colleagues come and ask questions, mails arrive, notifications pop up – a typical workday for me is often interrupted by various things, some more, some less important. Of course, this immediately kills productivity and concentration especially as a developer – there’s the one image describing it at its core:
